it.polimi.constraints.components

Class SubProperty

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.constraints.components.Component
      • it.polimi.constraints.components.SubProperty

  • public class SubProperty
extends Component
    The SubProperty class contains the description of a sub-property. The Sub-property class extends the Component by specifying the IBA which describes the claim the developer must consider in the refinement process.
    Author:
    claudiomenghi

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SubProperty(State modelState, BA automaton)
      creates a new sub-property that refers to a specific model state and contains the corresponding IBA

    • Constructor Detail

      • SubProperty

        public SubProperty(State modelState,
           BA automaton)
        creates a new sub-property that refers to a specific model state and contains the corresponding IBA
        Parameters:
        modelState - is the state of the model to which the sub-property corresponds with
        automaton - is the automaton related with the sub-property
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - is generated when the name of the state or when the state of the model is null

    • Method Detail

      • getAutomaton

        public BA getAutomaton()
        returns the incomplete Buchi automaton associated with the subProperty
        Returns:
        the IBA associated with the sub-property

        public Set<LabeledPluggingTransition> getOutgoingTransitions()

        Returns:
        a not modifiable set which contains the outcomingPorts of the component

        public void addOutgoingTransition(LabeledPluggingTransition port)
        adds an out-coming port to the component
        Parameters:
        port - is the port to be added as an out-coming port
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the port is null

      • removePluggingTransition

        public void removePluggingTransition(LabeledPluggingTransition p)
        removes the port from the set of incoming or outcoming port
        Parameters:
        p - is the port to be removed
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the port p is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if the port is not contained into the set of incoming or outcoming ports

      • addReachabilityRelation

        public void addReachabilityRelation(LabeledPluggingTransition outgoingTransition,
                           LabeledPluggingTransition incomingTransition,
                           Boolean modelAcceptingState,
                           Boolean claimAcceptingState)
        add a reachability entity, specifies that the destination port is reachable from the sourcePort through a path that only involves purely regular states
        Parameters:
        outgoingTransition - is the source port
        incomingTransition - is the destination
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if one of the ports is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if the source port is not an outgoing port of the sub-property
        IllegalArgumentException - if the destination port is not an incoming port of the sub-property

      • getLowerReachabilityRelation

        public ReachabilityRelation getLowerReachabilityRelation()

      • getUpperReachabilityRelation

        public ReachabilityRelation getUpperReachabilityRelation()

      • addPossibleReachabilityRelation

        public void addPossibleReachabilityRelation(LabeledPluggingTransition outgoingTransition,
                                   LabeledPluggingTransition incomingTransition,
                                   Boolean modelAcceptingState,
                                   Boolean claimAcceptingState)
        add a reachability entity, specifies that the destination port is reachable from the sourcePort through a path that only involves purely regular and mixed states
        Parameters:
        outgoingTransition - is the source port
        incomingTransition - is the destination
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if one of the ports is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if the source port is not an outgoing port of the sub-property
        IllegalArgumentException - if the destination port is not an incoming port of the sub-property

        Returns:

      • setGreenIncomingTransition

        public void setGreenIncomingTransition(LabeledPluggingTransition incomingTransition)
        sets the color of the incoming transition to green. The incoming transition must already be inserted into the set of the incoming transitions of the sub-property. If the incoming transition was already a yellow transition it is removed from the set of the yellow transitions
        Parameters:
        incomingTransition - the incoming transition whose color must be modified to green
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the incoming transition is green
        IllegalArgumentException - if the incoming transition is not contained into the set of incoming transitions of the sub-property
